task.title: Cleanup - Dishwashers
task.shortdesc: This is the cleaning procedure dishwashers should follow as part of the closing procedure.

context.p: All cleanup items should be completed as part of the closing procedure. See "Closing Procedure" for more information.

step.cmd: Obtain as many of the dirty dishes as possible before cleanup.
step.info: This will save you time since the cooks are likely to bring you more dishes later on.

step.cmd: Clean all dirty dishes as necessary. After the initial rush, be sure to empty any sinks that are not in use.
Once the main body of dishes are clean, begin washing out any sinks not currently in use. Rinse out any food and then allow the sinks to air-dry.
step.info: Dirty dishes may yet be received during this process. Keep one or two sinks full for scrubbing these dishes.

step.cmd: After all dishes and sinks have been cleaned, rinse out the washing machine. The washing machine should be turned off at this time.

substep.cmd: Rinse out each interior part of the washing machine. You may need to angle the hose to reach some of these areas.
Rinse out the food trays after the interior of the washing machine is rinsed. All food should be washed down the drain.

step.cmd: Once the washing machine has been rinsed out, tidy up your workstation.

substep.cmd: Place all clean items back in their original storage areas.
Clean all counters and surfaces in your workstation with a wash cloth and Natural A solution.
